p: In the past half century, the global health landscape has changed markedly for the better and will continue to do so. People are living longer, healthier lives, and indicators of infant, child, and maternal mortality show steady improvement. In their call for the new Sustainable Health Goal 1 to have measurable targets, Norheim and colleagues noted: ‘Throughout the world, except in countries where the effects of HIV or political disturbances predominated, mortality decreased substantially from 1970–2010, particularly in childhood’ (Norheim et al. 2015).
